Greetings. We are Mykara, the Custodians of Auriga.
#F3EAD8#Wars#REVERT# can leave scars that never heal. What of a #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT#?
We have witnessed the madness of too many #F3EAD8#wars#REVERT#. The Mykara agree to a #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT#.
Wars may destroy, but some enemies require destruction! We will prosecute this #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#. There will be no #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT#.
We stop this ruinous #F3EAD8#war#REVERT# and impose a healing #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT#.
We have no need of justice or vengeance; a #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT# is acceptable.
The roots of our peace are dying, weak and withered. Like winter, we move to #F3EAD8#cold war#REVERT#.
You kill the hope of peace and resurrect the specter of #F3EAD8#cold war#REVERT#. Some things are better left alone.
This #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# does not grow or nourish. #F3EAD8#Cold war#REVERT# better represents reality.
Clearly the #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# was dying, if #F3EAD8#cold war#REVERT# is more appropriate.
This #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT# is cold and lifeless, it is time for the heat of #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#!
By changing this #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT# to #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#, you risk fanning the flames of vengeance!
#F3EAD8#Cold war#REVERT# constrains our growth. It is time for #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#!
We prefer #F3EAD8#cold war#REVERT# to #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#, but we will still thrive.
This #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT# is a weak mockery; my nation must have #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#!
Though we have seen ages of #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#, we will not shy from it.
This #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# had the weight and strength of air. It is time for the substance of #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#.
You must feel rage indeed to switch so easily from #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# to #F3EAD8#war#REVERT#.
Nothing grows in a #F3EAD8#cold war#REVERT#. Would you consider #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT#?
We agree that life flourishes better in times of #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT#.
You offer #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT#, but it is a poisoned peace. We say no!
We did not thrive as we hoped in our #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#. Let us return to simple #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT#.
You leave our #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#, like removing a limb? Still, better #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT# than nothing.
Our #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# simply needs time to grow and flourish; we remain.
Our #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# dies so easily? Sad, but we can survive with #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT#.
There are times when the natural order must impose itself, and at the moment #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT# is demanded.
We are uneasy at #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT#, with you, but we shall see how it develops.
Better to face the storm as a forest than individual trees. What do you say to an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#?
We look forward to thriving in an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# with you.
There can be no #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# between us; not now.
As we flourish together, should our #F3EAD8#peace#REVERT# not become an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#?
We are pleased to accept your offer of an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#.
To form an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# with you is not auspicious.
We must force you into an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#, and into civilization.
It does not feel natural to move so abruptly from #F3EAD8#cold war#REVERT# to an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#, but we accept.
#F3EAD8#Peace#REVERT# is insufficient for our needs; we must have an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT#.
It is odd, your desire to create an #F3EAD8#alliance#REVERT# by force.
Do you find our offer promising?
We accept the terms of your offer.
We shall all grow strong from this offer.
This offer would twist our purpose; we do not accept.
Our growth and survival demands this decision.
We submit to your decision.
Auriga is fortunate to have such inhabitants as you.
We are thankful that you share our thoughts and attitudes.
You are growing thorns, not crops. Be careful.
Do not attempt to subjugate or control us!
With empires like ours, the future of Auriga seems better than it might have been.
We focus our rage on common enemies, so we share common needs.
Your empire and ours share friends. This is a hopeful sign.
Our alliance is a source of strength and life. We hope it continues.
We see that we have become neighbors; we hope you are symbiotic rather than parasitic.
The very roots of our empire become weary of this war, and our rage lessens.
Time heals all wounds and covers all scars; our previous war is barely a memory.
A cold war is not an invitation for acts of rage and violence. We hope you can contain yourselves in the future.
We have absorbed your city. Do you not see that the war has gone long enough?
Has the capture of a city sated your rage? Is it not time to recover, to grow?
Your armies cover the ground like autumn leaves.
Perhaps you should view us as a symbol, an aspiration of what an empire can become.
Truly, your empire thrives and flourishes as no other.
You have armies in my territory. Are they there to sow, or to reap?
Your peaceful behavior promises growth and satisfaction.
Our empires are two separate beings, pulled together by a common war.
We share friends, so perhaps we share a vision of survival and growth.
Our common friend has joined our alliance; let us hope we all share common dreams and desires.
You edge up against our territory. Please remain on your side of the fence.
The rage of war saps our force and exhausts our strength. We tire of conflict.
It is my hope that we can both view our previous conflicts as acts of passion, not as examples of long-term desires.
Do not force our rage to boil over from cold war to a hot one.
For our success and survival the capture of your city was a necessity.
You have taken our citizens and pretended their city is part of your empire. We do not forget.
Remember that if it comes to a test of strength, ours is overwhelming.
We see that you wave your weapons and sing your songs. You are powerful, but we are wise.
Tend to your gardens, and they may come to flourish as ours do.
You set an example, and we would do well to develop as you have.
Our territory may be bountiful, but that does not mean your troops should come and admire it.
We are indeed at peace, but your history makes us wonder if this is short-lived.
We have a common enemy, which means there is another empire we dislike more than you.
See that you tend to our common friends better than you dealt with us!
We now have a common ally, but I distrust your motives and methods.
Your remorseless desire to expand begins to push against our territory. Curb yourself.
I have seen the horrors of war for ages, but this is a case where we do not desire to put an end to them!
Your actions in previous conflicts make us incapable of viewing you as reliable or harmonious.
Your aggression make us writhe and goads us into anger!
Yes, we have taken one of your cities. Doubtless it will thrive with us as it never could have with you.
We are not surprised you have taken a city, as killing and theft appear to be your only skills.
Your empire is a laughing stock; its roots wither and its leaves droop.
As you grow stronger and more dangerous, you fill other empires with dread and hatred.
The stink of your troops on our lands outweighs the worst of our compost piles.
Join us and #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT#! It is for the good of all, and of Auriga.
We would go beyond a #F3EAD8#truce#REVERT#, and ask you to #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on this threat to our survival.
Our souls are open, as our borders, and in this spirit we ask that you #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on our enemy.
We can do more than trade together; join us and #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on our enemy!
We have a valuable peace between us; let us turn our anger against our enemy and #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT#.
Peace would be a valuable step, but if we are to thrive you must #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on our enemy.
Cold war has cold benefits. We ask that you join us in an alliance and #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on our enemy.
Let the first seed of this new alliance be to #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on this enemy.
Our shared alliance means shared growth and shared goals. We must ask that you share suffering as well, and #F3EAD8#declare war#REVERT# on our enemy.
If your needs were great, there is no harm in your act of #F3EAD8#pillage#REVERT#.
Auriga is a small planet, and resources are not infinite. #F3EAD8#Pillage#REVERT# its riches at your peril.
You reaped Auriga's resources without conscience. Be ready to suffer for your acts of #F3EAD8#pillage#REVERT#.
#F3EAD8#Pillage#REVERT# seems to be an ugly word, but if you are in need do not hesitate to harvest.
Your #F3EAD8#pillaging#REVERT# causes suffering. It would be better to stop.
You dare to harvest the riches of the entire planet as if it was yours? Cease your acts of #F3EAD8#pillage#REVERT# or be prepared to suffer.
You have sent #F3EAD8#spies#REVERT# to learn the ways of the Mykara? Your interest in our culture is fascinating.
You overstep your territory with these #F3EAD8#spies#REVERT#. Control yourselves, and we will hold our anger in check.
Your #F3EAD8#spies#REVERT# are not welcome! We are having difficulty restraining those who wish to see you punished.
Apparently we both hold prisoners; some over-curious travelers who studied each others lands. Shall we exchange them?
We are content to have our missing citizens home and safe.
The tendrils of our empire that erred in your lands are an embarrassment. We ask that they be returned.
We are happy to see our people return home, and have no need to hold yours hostage.
The Pearls incite growth, even in winter. We understand your interest!
The Pearls are almost sacred to the ancient peoples of Auriga; be reasonable as you harvest.
Your rapacious plundering of the Pearls cannot go on forever.
Your Skyfin is a welcome sight in the skies above our filaments.
Not all Mykara see the Skyfin as a good omen.
To many filaments, your Skyfin is an interloper and a thief!
By the grace of Auriga, you have #F3EAD8#eliminated our enemy#REVERT#!
You did #F3EAD8#eliminate our enemy#REVERT#, but you removed our right to retribution.
Why did you #F3EAD8#eliminate our enemy#REVERT#? The right to that vengeance was ours!
You #F3EAD8#eliminated one of our allies#REVERT#, but they were of little use to the Mykara.
Your anger is misplaced; you have #F3EAD8#eliminated an ally#REVERT#.
Your #F3EAD8#elimination of our ally#REVERT# is an act that demands retribution!
You #F3EAD8#eliminated our friends#REVERT#. But they were not true friends of the Mykara.
We seek to understand why you would #F3EAD8#eliminate our friend#REVERT#...
In your violent rage you have #F3EAD8#eliminated our friend#REVERT#. Such madness must be stopped, and we will do it if we must.
Filaments of the Mykara say that you have #F3EAD8#eliminated one of Auriga's races#REVERT#. We do not condemn these actions.
The filaments are everywhere, and they say that in your rage you have #F3EAD8#eliminated another of this world's peoples#REVERT#.
You have #F3EAD8#slaughtered a mutual acquaintance#REVERT#. You incite the Mykara to rage and vengeance.
The Mykara has learned that you have #F3EAD8#taken our enemy's city#REVERT#. We are content; perhaps jealous!
We see that you have #F3EAD8#taken our enemy's city#REVERT#. We hope your desire for conquest is now sated.
In your lust for violence you have #F3EAD8#taken our enemy's city#REVERT#. The Mykara does not approve.
You #F3EAD8#took an ally's city#REVERT#, but they are an ally in name only.
The Mykara sees that you #F3EAD8#took an ally's city#REVERT#. Little escapes our notice; be careful.
You will unchain our rage for #F3EAD8#taking an ally's city#REVERT#!
Sometimes even a friend needs a stern lesson; we do not mind the #F3EAD8#capture of their city#REVERT#.
You #F3EAD8#took our friend's city#REVERT# without hesitation. Perhaps you will hesitate next time?
We have seen the ruin of war for ages, and your #F3EAD8#capture of our friend's city#REVERT# angers us.
We assume that your #F3EAD8#war with our ally#REVERT# is a just one.
The filaments speak of a #F3EAD8#war with our ally#REVERT#. Tread carefully.
Your #F3EAD8#war against our ally#REVERT# is an act of hatred and violence that we do not accept.
Your #F3EAD8#betrayal of our ally#REVERT# seems odd, but it does not affect the Mykara.
You #F3EAD8#betrayed one of our allies#REVERT#. The Mykara find that unpleasant, but will not seek revenge.
Your #F3EAD8#betrayal of our ally#REVERT# says that soon you will be coming for the Mykara. Our rage begins to boil.
You #F3EAD8#betrayed our friend#REVERT#, but that may just make them appreciate the Mykara even more.
The news of your #F3EAD8#betrayal of our friend#REVERT# is unfortunate and unworthy.
Your decision to #F3EAD8#betray our friend#REVERT# may have come lightly, but the consequences will be heavy!
We see you did not like our volcanoformation machine, and we are also glad to see it go.
You ruined a Mykara volcanoformation machine, but we do not feel a need for vengeance.
Your desire for ruin extends to our volcanoformation machine! You seem to be a force of violence and evil.
The lands you have volcanoformed have a feel and flavor that we find pleasing.
You should not volcanoform in our lands without permission! Be careful of your wanton ways.
You parch and salt our lands with your volcanoformation? This is theft and violence!
The hard, flat lands you are volcanoforming let our armies see enemies more easily.
Do you wish to cook Mykara armies with your volcanoforming? Be careful, that is not a toy.
You attempt to burn and wither our armies with your volcanoformation. Cease this violence!
We note that you have removed a #F3EAD8#Fungal Bloom#REVERT#. We understand that not all peoples appreciate the fragrance.
You dug up our #F3EAD8#Fungal Bloom#REVERT#? We hope that you had a good reason to do so.
A #F3EAD8#Fungal Bloom#REVERT# is like family to us, and what you have done is murder!
We note that you have placed a #F3EAD8#Fungal Bloom#REVERT# nearby, and hope that it flourishes.
We have noted the placement of your #F3EAD8#Fungal Bloom#REVERT#, and will keep a wary eye on it.
We do not wish the stink of your #F3EAD8#Fungal Bloom#REVERT# so close to our lands.
One of your Urkan frolics in a neighboring region; we hope that it is friendly and housebroken.
We are wary of your nearby Urkan, and will react if you use it against us!
Your placement of an Urkan so close to us is almost an act of war!
The Urkan was a means of self-defense, and it is unfortunate that you have deprived us of it.
You have destroyed our attempt to control an Urkan, and we do not appreciate that!
You would kill anything to have your way, even one of the Urkans of Aurgia!
The Urkan was important to the Mykara, and we are sad that you felt forced to destroy it.
The Urkan was an extension of our Mykara nation, and your attack on it is not appreciated!
Your reckless butchering of the Urkan will not be forgiven by the Mykara!
You have led an Urkan into a region neighboring the Mykara; we hope it is only there for defensive reasons.
The Mykara are wary of your nearby Urkan; our filaments observe it, and we are ready to react.
Your Urkan gazes at our territory with hunger; you may learn that there are some spores that are quite deadly.
The Urkan you defeated was beginning to get expensive. The Mykara are not unhappy to see it go.
Our bond with the Urkan is an old one, and you have ruptured it. We hope you had good reason.
You would leave the Mykara defenseless by destroying our Urkan? You will drive us to rage and vengeance.
Your Fungal Bloom is fascinating, and we are curious to see what it will become.
A Fungal Bloom is like a structure, and you should be more careful where you build it.
Your Fungal Bloom is an invasive and unwanted species!
Your Urkan roams in a neighboring region; we will observe it with curiosity.
We see your Urkan nearby, and wonder if it there as a threat...
If you attack us with this Urkan on our border, you will learn the meaning of rage...
The Urkan was as strange as it was powerful, and we are not unhappy to no longer have to care for it.
You meddle in the affairs of our empire when you attack our Urkan. Be careful.
Your butchery of the Urkan is an unpardonable offense!
We survived many years in the caves on mushrooms, so your Fungal Bloom intrigues us.
Though we share your curiosity of the Fungal Bloom, we are not happy about your placement of it.
Your Fungal Bloom brings back unpleasant memories, and we would like you to remove it!
Your Urkan is a strange as it is fascinating; we are content to regard it.
We do not fear beasts or war; if you move your Urkan towards us you will learn this.
We view your nearby Urkan as a means to an invasion, and will react accordingly!
We are not happy that you destroyed our Urkan, but it was a very expensive experiment.
We can no longer learn of the Urkans since you destroyed ours; that is a loss to our science.
Your desire to kill and destroy has deprived us of our Urkan!
Your Fungal Bloom is fascinating, as we are always interested in new sources of food.
If your Fungal Bloom is an offensive weapon, we will react exactly as you expect.
Remove your Fungal Bloom. We do not want it so near.
This Urkan you have let loose next to us is stranger and uglier than we are.
Your Urkan is large and impressive. Make sure that it is also distant.
We are watching your Urkan, with sharp knives and empty bellies, waiting for an excuse...
The Urkan required too much food and was difficult to control; we will not miss it.
If the Urkan was to be killed, it should have been killed by us. You meddle.
You have destroyed our Urkan; the Hive's hunger and anger turn toward you.
We are curious to see what substances come from your nearby Fungal Bloom.
Your Fungal Bloom seems strange to us; we shall eye it closely.
We do not like your Fungal Bloom near our territory; remove it unless you wish to suffer.
We are curious to learn more of the Urkan you have placed near our lands .
Your Urkan is both a distraction and a threat; we are not happy to see it so near.
If you leave your Urkan so close to us, we shall begin inventing an agonizing penance for you.
The Urkan was too much of a brute and blunt instrument; its loss does not bother us.
We would have liked to learn more of the limits of the Urkan; why did you destroy it?
The Urkan was ours to drive mad with penance, not yours to kill!
The Fungal Bloom that has blossomed near us looks interesting... and profitable?
As long as your Fungal Bloom does not interfere with trade, we will not spoil it.
The stench of your Fungal Bloom drives customers away! Remove it.
It is most amusing to watch the Urkan you have placed near us. We may sell tickets to viewings.
Something as dangerous as an Urkan, so close to us, risks having a bad effect on business...
Did you place your Urkan to scare off business and cut off trade? It is unacceptable!
The clans were tiring of the noise and smell of the Urkan; we will not miss it.
The Urkan was an expensive investment! We would rather you had not destroyed it.
How dare you destroy that Urkan? These beasts are rare, and you have made us lose Dust!
We shall study your Fungal Bloom with curiosity and an open mind.
We are not entirely happy with your Fungal Bloom, but will let it be.
Your Fungal Bloom so close to us upsets the balance! It must go.
The Urkan is one of Auriga's creatures, so we are content to study and observe it.
The Urkan near our borders is a thing of great power. To be honest, it makes us uneasy...
You pressure our borders with a monstrous Urkan! This situation cannot be allowed to last.
It is sad to see a creature die, even a monstrous Urkan, but the end comes to all things.
Your willingness to destroy our Urkan upsets the equilibrium of Auriga; we are not happy.
Killing an Urkan is a terrible act upon a noble creature! How will you recompense us?
The Queen has noted your Fungal Bloom nearby, and is curious. Be happy.
The Eternal End watches all things, and is concerned about your Fungal Bloom.
The Unspoken hates your Fungal Bloom; it may be the end of you.
We watch your Urkan nearby, and wonder what purpose it serves in the plans of the Queen.
We see your Urkan near us; be careful that it does not enrage the Unspoken.
You try to goad us to fear with your Urkan! The Cult knows no fear, and no pity.
Our Urkan is gone. Apparently, it was not part of the greater design intended by the Queen.
The Urkan was a symbol of the power of the Eternal End! How dare your terminate it!
As you destroyed the Urkan that had the Queen's favor, it is expected that we destroy you.
We see your nearby Fungal Bloom. It's weird, but interesting.
That Fungal Bloom you're pushing up won't cause trouble, will it? Hmmm...
I don't like the look of your Fungal Bloom, and I don't want it around any more.
That Urkan is one big, ugly mug. Fun to watch, even though it is very close.
We look at that Urkan every day, and wonder why you put it right next to us.
Putting that Urkan next door means you want trouble. We can provide plenty of that.
Did you really have to kill our Urkan? Well, maybe you did.
You should not have killed our Urkan. Those things are a pain to get control of.
Killing our Urkan was pretty much an act of war. Is that really what you want?
Even a blind person would notice your Fungal Bloom nearby. And we are not blind.
Your Fungal Bloom is a reason for concern. It makes us uneasy.
Our blades are ready and we are wondering: Should we harvest you, or your Fungal Bloom?
We learn much by watching your Urkan that is near us. We will continue to do so.
The Forgotten are uneasy with your giant Urkan so close to us.
To bring an Urkan so close means that you wish to use it against us. Do we prepare for war?
It was a strange, dangerous, and ugly thing, the Urkan. Still, we will miss it.
Our Urkan is dead at your hands. We will not riposte, but we are not happy.
When you kill our Urkan, it is like killing one of our children. Imagine how we feel about that.
Your nearby Fungal Bloom is yet another of the many strange and wonderful things upon Auriga.
Though your Fungal Bloom is a natural growth of Auriga, its location concerns us.
Your Fungal Bloom is like a spy or invasion beachhead! If it stays, we will react.
Perhaps the greatest and weirdest of Auriga's creatures is your Urkan; it amuses us.
The placement of your Urkan is a matter of concern. You will make us wary of you.
We must assume that the Urkan next to us is there for conquest!
We are sad to see a creature of Auriga die. The Urkan, however, will not be missed.
You kill a bit too easily; we would have preferred to keep our Urkan.
By destroying our Urkan you attack us directly! We shall ponder our retaliation.
Your strange Fungal Bloom near our lands does not worry us. Its strangeness fascinates.
We trust others very little, and the Fungal Bloom nearby does not help.
You place a Fungal Bloom as a prelude to attack. This is obvious.
We admire your Urkan; keep it close, where we can track it.
We see your Urkan--all of us--and we will react if it does anything foolish.
We see your Urkan, and also see that it is a means to attack and control us.
Must you destroy our Urkan? The lonely, angry beast was almost like kin to us.
The control of other beings is our shield, and we no longer control the Urkan you destroyed.
Our Urkan was useful. You have destroyed it as a prelude to attack. We sense your contempt and hatred.
Another strange wonder of Auriga, this Fungal Bloom you have placed near us.
We regard your Fungal Bloom as another dangerous alien species.
We do not like your Fungal Bloom, nor you. It must be purified with flame.
Your Urkan amuses itself near our lands; perhaps it will like the taste of ash and lava?
We expect you will not use your Urkan against us. But it is close, and we are uneasy.
Our shamans will see your Urkan die in flames if you leave it so close to us!
You have deprived us of our Urkan. It was a violent beast, and we do not miss it.
You decided to destroy our Urkan. We wonder where your urge to destroy leads you next.
There is no excuse for the destruction of our Urkan! We will see that the fires punish you.
Fungal Bloom disposed
Though you #F3EAD8#ally with an enemy#REVERT#, we feel the fires of hope still burn inside you.
You #F3EAD8#ally with an enemy#REVERT#. Whether this is good or bad, the flames don't tell.
#F3EAD8#Ally with an enemy#REVERT# then! Nothing but ash will remain of your empire!
You #F3EAD8#ally with an enemy#REVERT#, but these ties will not bind.
You #F3EAD8#ally with an enemy#REVERT#, but the consequences are dark and tangled.
You dare to #F3EAD8#ally with an enemy#REVERT#? We will choke you for this folly.
Zolya's Blade
An heirloom of the great Vaulter line, legend has it that Zolya's Blade was forged among the stars millenia past. Ingrained with hyperium, it gives off a faint amethyst glow.
Testament of the Urkans
A cryptic tome offering half-truths and speculations on the great Urkan beasts. Costly investigations will need to be performed before this becomes useful knowledge.
Wild Urkans Guidebook

Assembled from painstaking investigations inspired by speculative theories from the ancient "Testament of the Urkans" tome, the guidebook gives valuable insights into the great beasts, with tangential lessons in leadership.
Talisman of Courage
Infused with a strange ancient technology, the amulet was rumored to have been worn by legendary Drakken who fought the Urkans long ago.
I unearthed an ancient organism
and named it... Mykara.
Hardy, energetic, invasive...
I encouraged its growth, let it in.
It transformed our knowledge... our lives...
...our understanding of the Urkans.
But the Mages, our old enemy,
gained control of one of them...
...and, together,
they slaughtered all but one.
Me.
That day I gave myself fully to the Mykara.
And we became a fearsome power...
hungry for vengeance...
